channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing Molecular Property Prediction via Mixture of Collaborative Experts
item.description: To address data scarcity and imbalance in MPP, some studies have adopted Graph Neural Networks (GNN) as an encoder to extract commonalities from molecular graphs.

item.title: PneumoLLM: Harnessing the Power of Large Language Model for Pneumoconiosis Diagnosis
item.description: Yet, this approach often requires optimization of extensive learnable parameters in the text branch and the dialogue head, potentially diminishing the LLMs' efficacy, especially with limited training data.

item.title: AMR Parsing is Far from Solved: GrAPES, the Granular AMR Parsing Evaluation Suite
item.description: We present the Granular AMR Parsing Evaluation Suite (GrAPES), a challenge set for Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) parsing with accompanying evaluation metrics.

item.title: OneLLM: One Framework to Align All Modalities with Language
item.description: In detail, we first train an image projection module to connect a vision encoder with LLM.

item.title: Lazy-k: Decoding for Constrained Token Classification
item.description: We explore the possibility of improving probabilistic models in structured prediction.

item.title: Online Vectorized HD Map Construction using Geometry
item.description: In our work, we propose GeMap ($\textbf{Ge}$ometry $\textbf{Map}$), which end-to-end learns Euclidean shapes and relations of map instances beyond basic perception.

item.title: STEP CATFormer: Spatial-Temporal Effective Body-Part Cross Attention Transformer for Skeleton-based Action Recognition
item.description: We think the key to skeleton-based action recognition is a skeleton hanging in frames, so we focus on how the Graph Convolutional Convolution networks learn different topologies and effectively aggregate joint features in the global temporal and local temporal.

item.title: JAMMIN-GPT: Text-based Improvisation using LLMs in Ableton Live
item.description: We introduce a system that allows users of Ableton Live to create MIDI-clips by naming them with musical descriptions.

item.title: Editable Stain Transformation Of Histological Images Using Unpaired GANs
item.description: Double staining in histopathology, particularly for metaplastic breast cancer, typically employs H&E and P63 dyes.

item.title: Texture-Semantic Collaboration Network for ORSI Salient Object Detection
item.description: In the TSCM, we first enhance the position of potential salient regions using semantic features.

item.title: Compressed Context Memory For Online Language Model Interaction
item.description: Through evaluations on conversation, personalization, and multi-task learning, we demonstrate that our approach achieves the performance level of a full context model with $5\times$ smaller context memory space.

item.title: Open-sourced Data Ecosystem in Autonomous Driving: the Present and Future
item.description: With the continuous maturation and application of autonomous driving technology, a systematic examination of open-source autonomous driving datasets becomes instrumental in fostering the robust evolution of the industry ecosystem.

item.title: Speculative Exploration on the Concept of Artificial Agents Conducting Autonomous Research
item.description: This paper engages in a speculative exploration of the concept of an artificial agent capable of conducting research.

item.title: Low-shot Object Learning with Mutual Exclusivity Bias
item.description: This paper introduces Low-shot Object Learning with Mutual Exclusivity Bias (LSME), the first computational framing of mutual exclusivity bias, a phenomenon commonly observed in infants during word learning.

item.title: Improving Bias Mitigation through Bias Experts in Natural Language Understanding
item.description: To mitigate the detrimental effect of the bias on the networks, previous works have proposed debiasing methods that down-weight the biased examples identified by an auxiliary model, which is trained with explicit bias labels.

item.title: Improving the Generalization of Segmentation Foundation Model under Distribution Shift via Weakly Supervised Adaptation
item.description: The success of large language models has inspired the computer vision community to explore image segmentation foundation model that is able to zero/few-shot generalize through prompt engineering.

item.title: Training Neural Networks on RAW and HDR Images for Restoration Tasks
item.description: Our results indicate that neural networks train significantly better on HDR and RAW images represented in display-encoded color spaces, which offer better perceptual uniformity than linear spaces.

item.title: High-Quality Facial Geometry and Appearance Capture at Home
item.description: Facial geometry and appearance capture have demonstrated tremendous success in 3D scanning real humans in studios.

item.title: Skeleton-in-Context: Unified Skeleton Sequence Modeling with In-Context Learning
item.description: Under this setting, the model can perceive tasks from prompts and accomplish them without any extra task-specific head predictions or model fine-tuning.

item.title: What Planning Problems Can A Relational Neural Network Solve?
item.description: Goal-conditioned policies are generally understood to be "feed-forward" circuits, in the form of neural networks that map from the current state and the goal specification to the next action to take.

item.title: f-FERM: A Scalable Framework for Robust Fair Empirical Risk Minimization
item.description: While numerous constraints and regularization terms have been proposed in the literature to promote fairness in machine learning tasks, most of these methods are not amenable to stochastic optimization due to the complex and nonlinear structure of constraints and regularizers.

item.title: Can language agents be alternatives to PPO? A Preliminary Empirical Study On OpenAI Gym
item.description: The formidable capacity for zero- or few-shot decision-making in language agents encourages us to pose a compelling question: Can language agents be alternatives to PPO agents in traditional sequential decision-making tasks?

item.title: Rethinking Object Saliency Ranking: A Novel Whole-flow Processing Paradigm
item.description: To conquer, this paper proposes a new paradigm for saliency ranking, which aims to completely focus on ranking salient objects by their "importance order".

item.title: DBCopilot: Scaling Natural Language Querying to Massive Databases
item.description: Text-to-SQL simplifies database interactions by enabling non-experts to convert their natural language (NL) questions into Structured Query Language (SQL) queries.

item.title: GPT-4 Enhanced Multimodal Grounding for Autonomous Driving: Leveraging Cross-Modal Attention with Large Language Models
item.description: In the field of autonomous vehicles (AVs), accurately discerning commander intent and executing linguistic commands within a visual context presents a significant challenge.

item.title: Reason2Drive: Towards Interpretable and Chain-based Reasoning for Autonomous Driving
item.description: Large vision-language models (VLMs) have garnered increasing interest in autonomous driving areas, due to their advanced capabilities in complex reasoning tasks essential for highly autonomous vehicle behavior.

item.title: SDSRA: A Skill-Driven Skill-Recombination Algorithm for Efficient Policy Learning
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel algorithm - the Skill-Driven Skill Recombination Algorithm (SDSRA) - an innovative framework that significantly enhances the efficiency of achieving maximum entropy in reinforcement learning tasks.

item.title: Multicoated and Folded Graph Neural Networks with Strong Lottery Tickets
item.description: The Strong Lottery Ticket Hypothesis (SLTH) demonstrates the existence of high-performing subnetworks within a randomly initialized model, discoverable through pruning a convolutional neural network (CNN) without any weight training.

item.title: CAFE: Towards Compact, Adaptive, and Fast Embedding for Large-scale Recommendation Models
item.description: Guided by our design philosophy, we further propose a multi-level hash embedding framework to optimize the embedding tables of non-hot features.

item.title: Physical Symbolic Optimization
item.description: We present a framework for constraining the automatic sequential generation of equations to obey the rules of dimensional analysis by construction.

item.title: Boosting legal case retrieval by query content selection with large language models
item.description: Legal case retrieval, which aims to retrieve relevant cases to a given query case, benefits judgment justice and attracts increasing attention.

item.title: Generalizable Neural Physics Solvers by Baldwinian Evolution
item.description: Physics-informed neural networks (PINNs) are at the forefront of scientific machine learning, making possible the creation of machine intelligence that is cognizant of physical laws and able to accurately simulate them.

item.title: Domain Invariant Representation Learning and Sleep Dynamics Modeling for Automatic Sleep Staging
item.description: However, previous studies face some critical problems in sleep studies; the heterogeneity of subjects' physiological signals, the inability to extract meaningful information from unlabeled sleep signal data to improve predictive performances, the difficulty in modeling correlations between sleep stages, and the lack of an effective mechanism to quantify predictive uncertainty.

item.title: Kandinsky 3.0 Technical Report
item.description: We focus on the key components that, as we have identified as a result of a large number of experiments, had the most significant impact on improving the quality of our model compared to the others.

item.title: UFineBench: Towards Text-based Person Retrieval with Ultra-fine Granularity
item.description: Firstly, we construct a new \textbf{dataset} named UFine6926.

item.title: Action Scene Graphs for Long-Form Understanding of Egocentric Videos
item.description: We present Egocentric Action Scene Graphs (EASGs), a new representation for long-form understanding of egocentric videos.

item.title: Learning From Scenarios for Stochastic Repairable Scheduling
item.description: We are interested in a stochastic scheduling problem, in which processing times are uncertain, which brings uncertain values in the constraints, and thus repair of an initial schedule may be needed.

item.title: Self-conditioned Image Generation via Generating Representations
item.description: During generation, RCG samples from such representation distribution using a representation diffusion model (RDM), and employs a pixel generator to craft image pixels conditioned on the sampled representation.

item.title: Machine Vision Therapy: Multimodal Large Language Models Can Enhance Visual Robustness via Denoising In-Context Learning
item.description: Concretely, by estimating a transition matrix that captures the probability of one class being confused with another, an instruction containing a correct exemplar and an erroneous one from the most probable noisy class can be constructed.

item.title: MKA: A Scalable Medical Knowledge Assisted Mechanism for Generative Models on Medical Conversation Tasks
item.description: Evaluation of our method is carried out on two typical medical datasets, MedDG and MedDialog-CN.

item.title: Simplifying Neural Network Training Under Class Imbalance
item.description: Real-world datasets are often highly class-imbalanced, which can adversely impact the performance of deep learning models.

item.title: Diffusion-SS3D: Diffusion Model for Semi-supervised 3D Object Detection
item.description: Semi-supervised object detection is crucial for 3D scene understanding, efficiently addressing the limitation of acquiring large-scale 3D bounding box annotations.

item.title: Are Vision Transformers More Data Hungry Than Newborn Visual Systems?
item.description: Thus, ViTs were not more data hungry than newborn visual systems: both learned view invariant object representations in impoverished visual environments.

item.title: PEFA: Parameter-Free Adapters for Large-scale Embedding-based Retrieval Models
item.description: For product search, PEFA improves the Recall@100 of the fine-tuned ERMs by an average of 5. 3% and 14. 5%, for PEFA-XS and PEFA-XL, respectively.

item.title: WoVoGen: World Volume-aware Diffusion for Controllable Multi-camera Driving Scene Generation
item.description: Generating multi-camera street-view videos is critical for augmenting autonomous driving datasets, addressing the urgent demand for extensive and varied data.

item.title: RankZephyr: Effective and Robust Zero-Shot Listwise Reranking is a Breeze!
item.description: In information retrieval, proprietary large language models (LLMs) such as GPT-4 and open-source counterparts such as LLaMA and Vicuna have played a vital role in reranking.

item.title: Calibrating dimension reduction hyperparameters in the presence of noise
item.description: However, there is a fundamental issue that is highly discussed in other modeling problems, but almost entirely ignored in the dimension reduction literature: overfitting.

item.title: SEVA: Leveraging sketches to evaluate alignment between human and machine visual abstraction
item.description: Sketching is a powerful tool for creating abstract images that are sparse but meaningful.

item.title: GIT-Net: Generalized Integral Transform for Operator Learning
item.description: This article introduces GIT-Net, a deep neural network architecture for approximating Partial Differential Equation (PDE) operators, inspired by integral transform operators.

item.title: BenchLMM: Benchmarking Cross-style Visual Capability of Large Multimodal Models
item.description: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) such as GPT-4V and LLaVA have shown remarkable capabilities in visual reasoning with common image styles.
